Markov Decision Processes¶

pymdp.mdp¶

Python representation of a Markov decision process, along with functions acting on the state space of an MDP.

A Markov decision process (MDP) is formally a tuple

\[(X, A, r, p, \beta)\]

where

  • \(X\) is the state space of the MDP, usually a point set,
  • \(A(x)\) is, for each state \(x \in X\), the action set of available actions at \(x\),
  • \(r(x,a)\) is, for each state \(x \in X\) and \(a \in A(x)\), the numerical one-step reward function at \(x\) with action \(a\),
  • \(p(y|x,a)\) is, for states \(x,y \in X\) and \(a \in A(x)\), the transition probability of the process arriving at the state \(y\) from the original state \(x\) by the action \(a\),
  • \(\beta\) is a number between \(0\) and \(1\) indicating the discount factor.
class pymdp.mdp.MDPFunction[source]¶

Standardized user-facing object for representing functions on the state space of an MDP.

Essentially, an MDPFunction is a dict whose items can be accessed via function calls. This is because many “functions” implemented throughout this library are actually dict objects masquerading as functions. Since they should be thought of as functions, this class provides the requisite interface to do so.

We promise that any MDPFunction can access its values via __call__, but the internal implementation may evolve over time.

class pymdp.mdp.MarkovDecisionProcess(states, actions, reward, transition, discount)¶

pymdp.mdp.default_policy(mdp, default=0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • mdp (MarkovDecisionProcess) – A given Markov decision process object
  • default (int) – The index of the default action for each state in the MDP (defaults to 0)
Returns:

The policy defined by \(\pi(x) = A(x)_i\) where i is the default index supplied.
Return type:

MDPFunction

Returns an arbitrary policy, which assigns to each state some available action.

Note that the default policy requires there to be an available action at every state. (TODO: generalize this)

pymdp.mdp.default_value(mdp, default=0.0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • mdp (MarkovDecisionProcess) – A given Markov decision process object
  • default (float) – The default output of the value function at each point in the state space.
Returns:

The constant value function \(v : X \to \mathbb{R}\) with the given v(x) = c, where \(c\) was supplied by default.
Return type:

MDPFunction

Returns the “default” value function, which assigns to each state the value default (if unset, this defaults to 0.).
